uk.co.nationalrail.xml.incident.PtIncide.ns3:Summary: Disruption between Sunderland and Middlesbrough / Northallerton expected until 12:30
uk.co.nationalrail.xml.incident.PtIncide.ns3:Description:
The emergency services are dealing with an incident betwen between Sunderland and Middlesbrough / Northallerton. As a result of this, trains may be cancelled or delayed.

This is expected until 12:30.

Grand Central Customer Advice

You may use your ticket at no extra cost on the following services:

  • CrossCountry services via any reasonable route
  • LNER services via any reasonable route
  • Northern services via any reasonable route
  • Transpennine Express services via any reasonable route

 

Northern Customer Advice

You may use your ticket at no extra cost on the following services:

  • Tyne and Wear Metro services between Newcastle and Sunderland
  • LNER services between Newcastle and Darlington
  • TransPennine Express services between Newcastle and Darlington


Road replacement transport has been recruited and will operate as follows:

10.35 Hartlepool - via booked stations - Stockton and drop off as required to Middlesbrough.(Operated by Delta)

10.35 Middlesbrough - via booked stations - Seaton Carew and drop as required to Newcastle. (Operated by Delta)


Check before you travel:

You can check your journey using the National Rail Enquiries real-time Journey Planner

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages

Twitter:
If you would like to follow this incident on Twitter, please use #Billingham

Compensation:
You may be entitled to compensation if you experience a delay in completing your journey today. Please keep your train ticket and make a note of your journey, as both will be required to support any claim.

Feedback:
We want to make information better - tell us how! Fill out this online Disruption Survey.

ns3:Affects.ns3:RoutesAffected:
Grand Central between Sunderland and London Kings Cross

\n

Northern between Hexham / Newcastle and Nunthorpe
